Common Issue: Missing Git command after installation
Solution: Ensure that Git is added to your system PATH during installation.

Common Issue: Installation fails on Windows
Solution: Run installer as administrator

Common Issue: Unable to install Git on macOS
Solution: Use Homebrew: `brew install git` or download from the official site.

Common Issue: Git installation hangs or freezes
Solution: Disable antivirus temporarily during installation.

Common Issue: Error: "Not a git repository" after install
Solution: Ensure you are in a directory initialized as a Git repository.

Common Issue: Ignoring changes to a tracked file
Solution: Git doesn't provide a direct way; consider using template files

Common Issue: Changing saved password or token in credential manager
Solution: Use `git credential reject` to erase existing credentials

Common Issue: Using multiple accounts with the same hosting provider (HTTP)
Solution: Use different usernames in the URL for each account

Common Issue: Files still tracked after being added to .gitignore
Solution: Use `git rm --cached <file/pattern>` to untrack files

Common Issue: Recommended way to store files in Git
Solution: Use UTF-8 encoding without BOM, LF line endings, and set appropriate gitattributes

Common Issue: Merge conflicts not resolving
Solution: Use `git merge --abort` to resolve conflicts or manually edit the conflicting files.

Common Issue: Syncing a working tree across systems
Solution: Use `rsync` with caution, or prefer normal push/pull mechanisms

Common Issue: Changing the last commit
Solution: Use `git commit --amend`

Common Issue: Undoing a change in the main branch
Solution: Use `git revert`

Common Issue: Unexpected results when merging branches with reverted changes
Solution: Consider using rebase instead of merge in specific scenarios

Common Issue: Text files detected as binary on Windows
Solution: Specify a working tree encoding using gitattributes

Common Issue: Files showing ^M at line endings on Windows
Solution: Set `core.eol` to native and configure files as text or binary

Common Issue: File always showing as modified
Solution: Could be due to case-insensitive file systems; remove one of the conflicting files

Common Issue: Git version not compatible with other tools
Solution: Update Git to the latest version to ensure compatibility with other tools.

Common Issue: SSH keys not recognized with certain servers
Solution: Verify that the SSH keys are correctly configured and added to the SSH agent.
